title: [Bugs] Error while Backuping in the XSeg Trainer
body:
## Expected behavior

When using the backup function in XSeg Trainer, the backup of XSeg Model shall be generated.

## Actual behavior
## Steps to reproduce

When using the backup function in XSeg Trainer, after pressing [b] to perform backup, the cmd window occur the below message.

`Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'C:\\Deep\\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA\\works
pace\\model\\XSeg_XSeg_256.npy'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Deep\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA\_internal\DeepFaceLab\mainscripts\Trainer.py"
, line 180, in trainerThread
    model_backup()
  File "C:\Deep\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA\_internal\DeepFaceLab\mainscripts\Trainer.py"
, line 73, in model_backup
    model.create_backup()
  File "C:\Deep\DeepFaceLab_NVIDIA\_internal\DeepFaceLab\models\ModelBase.py", l
ine 425, in create_backup
    shutil.copy ( str(filename), str(idx_backup_path / Path(filename).name) )
  File "shutil.py", line 245, in copy
  File "shutil.py", line 120, in copyfile
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'C:\\Deep\\DeepFaceLab_N
VIDIA\\workspace\\model\\XSeg_XSeg_256.npy'
Done.
Press any key to continue . . .`

My guess Is unlike the SAEHD / Quick96 Model Training, the XSeg Model do not need to give it a "name" for the Model, so this bug occurred when using backup?

## Other relevant information
- **Command lined used (if not specified in steps to reproduce)**: main.py ...
- **Operating system and version:** Windows7
- **Python version:** using prebuilt windows binary
